title: 107_s745
content: The Act may be cited as the "Better Nutrition for School Children Act of 2001" and addresses foods of minimal nutritional value. The "Better Nutrition for School Children Act of 2001" amends the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 to prohibit the sale, donation, or service of foods of minimal nutritional value on school grounds during the school breakfast or lunch programs. The term 'covered period' refers to the time before lunch in the school lunch program. The Secretary must review laws and regulations regarding the sale or donation of foods of minimal nutritional value on school grounds within 18 months of this paragraph's enactment. The Secretary must review laws and regulations regarding the sale or donation of foods of minimal nutritional value on school grounds before lunch in the school lunch program. Final regulations will be established for the sale, donation, or service without charge of such foods during this time. The regulations may include prohibiting these actions on all or part of school grounds. The Secretary will evaluate laws and regulations on the sale of foods of minimal nutritional value on school grounds before lunch. Regulations may prohibit the sale, donation, or service of such foods during this time based on nutritional science and student needs. The Secretary will evaluate laws and regulations on the sale of foods of minimal nutritional value on school grounds before lunch, considering various factors such as grade levels, proximity of such foods, student substitution behavior, and benefits to the school. Regulations may restrict the sale, donation, or service of these foods based on nutritional science and student needs. The Secretary of Agriculture must create regulations within 18 months to implement amendments related to the sale of foods of minimal nutritional value on school grounds. The regulations must be implemented without following the Paperwork Reduction Act, and the Secretary has the authority to use section 808 of title 5 for congressional review of agency rulemaking.
